titles: An elegy on the Death of the Duke of Cambridge, which happened on the 12th of December 1677. being our shortest day of the year.
publisher: Printed by T.D. for H. Brome.,
notes: Verse: "Since solemn mourners the bright day-beams ..."
On the death of Charles Stuart, aged 5 weeks; first son of James Duke of York (James II) by his second wife; designated Duke of Cambridge but died before the patent passed; cf. G.E. Cokayne.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Cambridge, Charles Stuart, --  Duke of, d. 1677 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
